Ingredients:

1 pound ground beef
1/2 cup breadcrumbs
1/4 cup milk
1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
1 egg
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
1/4 teaspoon onion powder
1 pound spaghetti
4 cups tomato sauce
Grated Parmesan cheese, for serving

Instructions:

Preheat the oven to 200°C.
In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, breadcrumbs, milk, Parmesan cheese, parsley, egg, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder until well combined.
Roll the mixture into 1-inch balls and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake the meatballs for 20-25 minutes, or until cooked through.
While the meatballs are cooking, cook the spaghetti according to the package directions.
Heat the tomato sauce in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Add the meatballs to the tomato sauce and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Serve the spaghetti topped with the meatballs and tomato sauce, and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

Ingredients:

1 pound fettuccine pasta
1/2 cup unsalted butter
2 cloves garlic, minced
2 cups heavy cream
1/4 teaspoon white pepper
1 1/2 cups freshly grated Parmesan cheese
2 cups cooked, diced chicken breast

Instructions:

Cook fettuccine pasta according to package directions.
While the pasta is cooking, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
Add heavy cream and white pepper to the skillet and bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat to low and whisk in Parmesan cheese until melted and sauce is smooth.
Add cooked chicken breast to the skillet and heat through.
Drain pasta and add to the skillet with the chicken alfredo sauce.
Toss pasta with sauce until evenly coated and serve hot.
